bibl.title: James Robinson v. Territory of Washington. Writ.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

msIdentifier.repository: Washington State Archives, Eastern Regional Branch
msIdentifier.collection: Walla Walla County Government; Clerk, Territorial Court Civil/Criminal Case Files, 1860-1889

div1.p: Territory of Washington County of Walla Walla } s.s.
To the Sheriff of the County of Walla Walla, Greeting: -

Whereas an application has been made, pursuent to law, to the Hon. E. P. Oliphant Judge of the District Court, First Judicial Districrt of said Terrritory, by James Robinson, in your custody, for a writ of Habeas Corpus, and alleging in said application or complaint that the said James Robinson is wrongfully and unlawfully restrained of his liberty and the order for the issuing of the writ of Habeas Corpus aforesaid having been granted and allowed this day by the said E.P. Oliphant, Judge as aforesaid as appears by complaint and order on file in my office, sow, therefore, in the name of the United States, and by the authority aforesaid, you are hereby commanded to have the body of the said James Robinson before the said Hon. E.P. Oliphant, Judge, as aforesaid at the Clerks Office, in the city of Walla Walla, County and Territory
aforesaid on Friday the 20th day of June A.D. 1862, at ten o'clock, A.M. of said say, togetheer with the causes and reasons whereof the said James Robinson is restrained of his liberty, and have then and there also this writ.
In witness whereof I have hereinto set my hand and affixed the seal of said Court, this 19th day of June, A.D. 1862.
div1.ab: B.N. Secton Clerk of said Court
div1.p: Territory of Washington vs James Robinson
June 20, 1862 that the defendant is to have a hearing before Justice Horton this day ato 2 O.C. P.M. time appointed, before this is of this writ, the hearing thereof is suspended.
div1.ab: E.P. Oliphant Also Just. at Court W.T.
